#######################################################
# env/requirements.txt : virtualenv package specs
#
# This file specifies the software packages for this project
# in a format that python's pip understands.
#
# From the project root folder (umber) , you can :
#
#  install a virtual python environment
#  $ virtualenv --python=2.7 venv
#
#  activate that python environement and set project shell variables
#  $ source env/activate_virtualenv
#
#  install the required python packages with
#  $ pip install < env/requirements.txt
#
#  recreate a file similar to this (after installing new packages) with
#  $ pip freeze > env/requirements_new.txt

arrow>=0.10.0

gunicorn>=19.7.1
idna>=2.6
ipaddress>=1.0.18
itsdangerous>=0.24

ldap3>=2.4
markdown2>=2.3.4
MarkupSafe>=1.0
packaging>=16.8
parsedatetime>=2.4
